cons:
-Paid less than other HBCUs in the metro area
-Sometimes onboarding takes a while

job_title: Financial Aid Counselor in Tougaloo, MS
pros: It is a small organization, so it is easy to know everyone you work with.
cons: Disorganized, Low Pay, Poor Benefits, Poor Leadership

pros: Tougaloo College has a rich history of with great people to connect with. There is always transformative work to be done and people to help.
cons: The is not much room for upward mobility. The compensation and benefits are lacking.

job_title: Registered Nurse, MPH, BSN in Batesville, MS
pros: A quiet understanding of a flexible schedule, Christian atmosphere, 2 weeks paid time off for Christmas.
cons: Micromanagment, unreasonable expectations, more work than what can be done in 8 hours.

pros: Supportive, caring, easy, accessible, academic freedom
cons: Pay not good, unorganized at times
You would have to experience it for yourself.

review_title: Not great but horizon looks better
pros: Generous leave, relaxed atmosphere, 100% paid health insurance, except for lower than average pay, they do try to take care of employees. The new president (2019) is shaking things up quite a bit, which needed to be done. Once new upper management is established, a lot could change for the better.
cons: Non-faculty salaries do not attract quality personnel. Salaries have not been raised in over a decade. Lack of cooperation between departments. General lack of accountability. As with most IHLs...lots of politics.

review_title: Good open family place to work
job_title: Keep IT Secret in Jackson, MS
pros: Flexibility, easy open culture, lots of time off and Flexibility, easy open culture, lots of time off
Dedicated employees and some of the students are very bright and hardworking.
cons: General level of chaos among the administration, particularly in the academic sectors.
